sat_simple.query: x is greater than 5 and less than 10
sat_simple.description: Simple satisfiable query with integer bounds

unsat_simple.query: x is greater than 10 and x is less than 5
unsat_simple.description: Simple unsatisfiable query with contradictory bounds

smtlib_direct_sat.description: Direct SMT-LIB code for satisfiable query

smtlib_direct_unsat.description: Direct SMT-LIB code for unsatisfiable query

complex_multi_variable.query: There are three variables x, y, and z representing ages. x is older than y. y is older than z. All ages are positive integers less than 100. Is it possible that x is 50?
complex_multi_variable.description: Complex query with multiple variables and constraints

needs_correction.query: x equals five plus y and y equals three
needs_correction.description: Query that may need correction by auto-fix

temporal_constraint.query: Event A happens before Event B, and Event B happens before Event C. Event A happens at time 0. Can Event C happen at time 10?

invalid_input.description: Invalid/gibberish input for error handling tests

complex_multi_phase.query: There are three variables x, y, and z representing ages. x is older than y. y is older than z. All ages are positive integers less than 100. Is it possible that x is 50?

auto_fix_test.query: There are three variables x y and z. x equals y plus z.
auto_fix_test.description: Query that may need auto-fix correction

long_running.query: There are five variables a, b, c, d, and e. Each variable is an integer between 1 and 100. The sum of all variables equals 250. a is greater than b. b is greater than c. c is greater than d. d is greater than e. All variables are different. Is there a solution where a equals 90?
long_running.description: Complex query that takes longer to process

smtlib_with_error.code:
(set-logic QF_LIA)
(declare-const x Int)
(assert (> x 5))
(assert (< x 10))
(assert (= undefined_var 5))
(check-sat)
(get-model)
